author: Simon Rimmer
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the vegetables, place all of the vegetables ingredients into a bowl and mix well. Transfer to a roasting tray, then place into the oven to roast for 20-25 minutes, or until golden-brown all over. For the steak, rub the steak with the oil and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat a frying pan until very hot. Add the steaks and cook for 1-2 minutes on both sides. Add the Cognac and cook for one minute. Be careful - the Cognac may flame. Add the mustard, Worcestershire sauce and cream and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the steak is cooked to your liking. Season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To serve, place a spoonful of roasted vegetables onto each plate. Add a steak on top of the vegetables and place some roasted new potatoes alongside, if using. Spoon the sauce all over.
ingredients: 1 parsnip, peeled, cut into batons,  2 carrots, peeled, cut into batons ,  1 red onion, peeled, cut into wedges,  2 beetroots, peeled, cut into wedges,  1 garlic clove ,  2 tbsp vegetable oil,  2 x 150g/5oz sirloin steaks (preferably aged for 21 days),  2 tbsp vegetable oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  75ml/2Â½fl oz Cognac,  1 tbsp Dijon mustard,  2 tsp Worcestershire sauce,  175ml/6fl oz whipping cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  6 baby new potatoes, roasted until golden-brown and tender (optional)
